title: Volodymyr Zelensky, a president with no term end
summary: Ukraine's president was elected in 2019, and his first term is supposed to have ended. But under the country's martial law, which was introduced because of the Russian invasion, no election can be held.

title: EU elections: French PM debates far right's Bardella in bid to close poll gap
summary: Two weeks ahead of the European elections, French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal and the head of the Rassemblement National (RN) list Jordan Bardella debated issues ranging from immigration to foreign policy with neither man gaining a clear upper hand.

title: Several top Russian army officials arrested in recent crackdown
summary: Accused of corruption and fraud, several high-ranking officers were arrested, including the deputy chief of the general staff. The Kremlin denies a 'campaign' of purges after the dismissal of Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu.

title: New Caledonia: Macron says he won't force through contested voting reform
summary: On a visit to the French territory in the Pacific, the president met with loyalist and pro-independence leaders after riots over a plan to reform the local voter lists.

title: When will China try to take over Taiwan?
summary: Lai Ching-te was officially sworn in as Taiwan's new president on Monday. Like his predecessor, he will have to contend with Xi Jinping's repeated attempts to integrate the island into the Chinese fold.

title: Young people still go to the movies and have high expectations of theaters
summary: Two studies recently analyzed 16 to 30-year-olds' and 15 to 24-year-olds' relationship to movie theaters. They especially appreciate 'the big screen' and 'socializing with friends.'

title: China conducts major military drills around Taiwan
summary: Beijing intends the drills as 'strong punishment' for the new president, Lai Ching-te, who adopted an aggressive stance in his inaugural speech.

title: Young graduates in India are disenchanted by lack of opportunities
summary: Over 40% of university graduates under the age of 25 are unemployed, forcing them into irregular and informal work. This situation is largely due to the scarcity of job opportunities, seen as a consequence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's policies.

title: UN approves resolution to commemorate the 1995 Srebrenica genocide
summary: The UN General Assembly on Thursday established an annual day to commemorate the genocide of more than 8,000 Bosnian Muslims by Bosnian Serbs, despite vehement opposition by Serbs.

title: Spain: Four dead in Mallorca restaurant roof collapse
summary: According to the emergency services, 21 other people are injured, with seven in a 'very serious' state.

title: Cannes 2024: 'Seeds of the Wild Fig Tree' is at the cutting edge of underground Iranian cinema
summary: As Mohammad Rasoulof takes part in the official competition from exile in Europe, a new generation of Iranian filmmakers is trying to break free from censorship.

title: US Justice Department sues Ticketmaster and Live Nation, saying illegal monopoly raises prices
summary: The anti-trust lawsuit filed in federal court in Manhattan against Ticketmaster and its parent company accuses them of practices that allow it to maintain a stronghold over the live music scene.

title: Group of graduates walk out of Harvard commencement chanting 'Free, free Palestine'
summary: Hundreds in graduation robes walked out after weeks of protests on campus and a day after the school announced that 13 Harvard students who participated in a protest encampment would not be able to receive diplomas alongside their classmates

title: Nadal to face Zverev in first round of farewell French Open
summary: Rafael Nadal will face the world number four Alexander Zverev in what is expected to be his last match at the Grand Slam tournament he has won 14 times – unless he can pull off an upset.

title: Iranian president Raisi buried after dying in helicopter crash
summary: The 63-year-old died on Sunday alongside his foreign minister and six others after their helicopter went down in the country's mountainous northwest. Hundreds of thousands marched in Raisi's hometown of Mashhad ahead of his burial.

title: New Delhi crushed by severe heatwave: 'It's 40°C inside my house'
summary: In the Indian capital, which has been placed on red alert, temperatures are reaching 47°C during the day. Often living in precarious housing, the poorest people are particularly vulnerable.

title: 'The Madonna of Chancellor Rolin': The resurrection of a Van Eyck painting at the Louvre
summary: The 15th-century painting, whose restoration has revealed little-known details, is presented in a small but very rich exhibition.

title: Which countries officially recognize a State of Palestine?
summary: With Ireland, Norway and Spain announcing on Wednesday that they were preparing to officially recognize a Palestinian state, we take a look back at Palestine's journey to statehood.

title: Louisiana lawmakers criminalize possession of abortion pills without prescription
summary: The southern US state is set to reclassify two abortion-inducing drugs as controlled and dangerous substances under a bill that received final legislative approval Thursday and is expected to be signed into law by the governor.

title: French wolf population falls 9% in 2023
summary: The drop in the predator's population is the first in almost 10 years, according to loupfrance.fr, a site managed by France's biodiversity authority.
